Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.thread

Class StateMachine<State>

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
com.telenav.kivakit.core.thread.StateMachine<State>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Broadcaster, Listener, MessageTransceiver, Repeater, Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject
public final class StateMachine<State> extends BaseRepeater
A simple state machine with a single state that can be transitioned from one state to another and which allows a caller to wait for the machine to transition to a particular state.

Example 

 enum State { UNBORN, LIVING, DEAD }

     [...]

 var person = new StateMachine(State.UNBORN);

     [...]

 KivaKitThread.run("Life", () ->
 {
     // Get born
     person.transitionTo(LIVING);

     // live life
     while (person.is(LIVING))
     {
         doSomething();
     }

     // then exit.
 });

 KivaKitThread.run("GrimReaper", () ->
 {
     // Wait a while
     Duration.years(random(101)).sleep();

     // then kill the person
     person.transitionTo(DEAD);
 });

 KivaKitThread.run("FuneralHome", () ->
 {
     // Wait for some business
     person.waitFor(DEAD);

     // then make some money.
     cashIn();
 });
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • toggle

      public Optional<State> toggle(State one, State two)
      Toggles between two states by transitioning from one to the other
      Parameters:
      one - The first state
      two - The second state
      Returns:
      The previous state, or null if toggling is not possible because this state machine isn't in either state

    • transition

      public boolean transition(State from, State to)
      If we are in the 'from' state, transition to the 'to' state.
      Parameters:
      from - The expected state
      to - The desired state
      Returns:
      True if a state change occurred

    • transition

      public boolean transition(State from, State to, State waitFor, Duration maximumWait, Runnable before)
      If the state is equal to the 'from' state, transition to the 'to' state and then wait for the 'waitFor' state. An example use case is to transition from RUNNING to STOPPING and then wait for STOPPED.
      Parameters:
      from - The expected initial state
      to - The state to transition to
      waitFor - The state to wait for if the transition is successful
      before - Code to run while holding the state machine lock but before attempting to transition to a new state. This code might be used to interrupt a thread, for example.
      Returns:
      True if desired state was reached

    • transition

      public boolean transition(State from, State to, State waitFor, Runnable before)
      Transition and wait forever for the given state
      See Also:
      • transition(Object, Object, Object, Duration, Runnable)

      public State transitionTo(State state)
      Transitions to the given state regardless of the current state
      Returns:
      The prior state

      public com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.time.WakeState waitFor(State state)
      Waits forever for the given state to be achieved
      Parameters:
      state - The state to wait for
      Returns:
      The wake state of the wait operation

      Returns:
      The wake state of the wait operation

    • waitFor

      public com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.time.WakeState waitFor(Predicate<State> predicate, Duration maximumWait, Runnable beforeWaiting)
      Waits until the given predicate is satisfied
      Parameters:
      predicate - The desired state
      maximumWait - The maximum amount of time to wait
      beforeWaiting - Code to run after locking the state machine but before waiting for the predicate. This code might interrupt another thread, for example.
      Returns:
      The wake state of the wait operation

    • waitForNot

      public com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.time.WakeState waitForNot(State state)
      Waits until this state machine is NOT in the given state
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The wake state of the wait operation
